p: Few studies in human beings are available to investigate the anti-cancerous and bone and muscle strengthening potential of the plant. In one such study, administration of root extract of W. somnifera (2.0 g tds) during three courses of chemotherapy of breast cancer-bearing fifty women lowered fatigue with improvement of quality of life ( 263). Two groups of 35 individuals each suffering from sarcopenia were fed 500 and 750 mg of root extract for three months to improve the strength and functioning of muscles ( 264). Root extract, when administered to males at 300 mg, twice a day for 8 weeks, increased the strength, size, and recovery of body muscles along with serum testosterone ( 265). The findings of these studies are encouraging and will help in the future to isolate the bioactives responsible for these activities in pure form.
